Welcome to the Udayalwani Media Channel. Now, listen to Udayalwani, and I am Udayalwani Jayesh Amrita Sanjay Kumar Babbu. The recent legal amendments are historic. These laws were implemented by our scholar, Kishen Kumar Thakur. Mr. Kishen Kumar Thakur will explain whether these amendments are beneficial to the public or not. Three major amendments to the Criminal Major Act have been made, and it can be said that the new laws replacing them are largely beneficial to the public. These amendments remove the vestiges of British rule from our laws. They enhance citizen security and rights. The previously one-sided, or rather, repressive nature of the police force against ordinary citizens has been curbed. This has resulted in significant benefits. Furthermore, our Indian Penal Code, renamed the Indian Justice Code, has undergone substantial and valuable changes. The number of sections, previously 511, has been reduced to approximately 356. Similarly, offences related to women's harassment are now placed in the first chapter of this Act. Likewise, crimes causing harm to humans are in the second chapter, given priority. Similarly, the CRPC has also been amended, increasing the number of sections. Therefore, the revised order, formerly section 420, is now under the third section. Sections 500 and above, encompassing various offences, have been removed. This is a correct decision by the government, arrived at after thorough consideration and consultation with experts. Many scholars and advocates contributed to its creation. It has now been sent to the translation committee. After that, it will be presented in the Lok Sabha and the Rajya Sabha. There is scope for further amendments. Therefore, this law is beyond the purview of elections; it is universally known and inevitable, with no room for compromise.
